Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class MSP::Matrix< T >

Multidimensional rapresentation of an object .

template<typename T>
Matrix< T > & MSP::Matrix< T >::edges ( Matrix< T > &  edges,
uint  threshold 
) [inline]

Edge detection with Prewitt algorithm .

Mathematically, the operator uses two 3×3 kernels which are convolved with the original image to calculate approximations
of the derivatives - one for horizontal changes, and one for vertical.
If we define as the source image, and and are two images which at each point
contain the horizontal and vertical derivative approximations, the latter are computed as :

Parameters:
edges Destination matrix for edges .
threshold Threshold value to use in Prewitt algorithm .

template<typename T>

Edge detection with Prewitt algorithm .

Mathematically, the operator uses two 3×3 kernels which are convolved with the original image to calculate approximations
of the derivatives - one for horizontal changes, and one for vertical.
If we define as the source image, and and are two images which at each point
contain the horizontal and vertical derivative approximations, the latter are computed as :

Parameters:
threshold Threshold value to use in Prewitt algorithm .

template<typename T>
Matrix< T > & MSP::Matrix< T >::orientation ( Matrix< double > &  orientation,
uint  blocksize = DEFAULT_ORIENT_BSIZE,
int  filtersize = DEFAULT_ORIENT_FSIZE 
) [inline]

Compute orientation map of the matrix .

Compute a map that contains the ridge orientation of the matrix . The values representing the orientation vary between -PI/2 and PI/2 . The low-pass filter size is intented to exclude errors from computation .

Parameters:
orientation Destination matrix for the map .
blocksize Size of block to consider for map computation .
filtersize Low-pass filter size .
See also:
Matrix::orientation_lowpass

template<typename T>
Matrix< T > & MSP::Matrix< T >::orientation ( uint  blocksize = DEFAULT_ORIENT_BSIZE,
int  filtersize = DEFAULT_ORIENT_FSIZE 
) [inline]

Compute orientation map of the matrix .

Compute a map that contains the ridge orientation of the matrix . The values representing the orientation vary between -PI/2 and PI/2 . The low-pass filter size is intented to exclude errors from computation .

Parameters:
blocksize Size of block to consider for map computation .
filtersize Low-pass filter size .
See also:
Matrix::orientation_lowpass

template<typename T>
Matrix< T > & MSP::Matrix< T >::features ( vector< Matrix< T > * > &  features,
Matrix< T > &  orientation,
Matrix< T > &  entropy,
uint  minneighbours,
uint  maxneighbours 
) [inline]

Compute matrix features by neighbours counting .

Parameters:
features Destination vector of the features .
Each feature is a 4x1 matrix in the form ( x, y, neighbours, orientation ) .
orientation Orientation mask computed with Matrix::orientation .
entropy Entropy mask computed with Matrix::entropy .
minneighbours Minimum number of neighbours for a pixel to be considered as a feature .
maxneighbours Maximum number of neighbours for a pixel to be considered as a feature .
